data.text: @perreault_jim The Maryland State data and the NYT data both use that, but tbh the moving of the decimal is something I can manage. 😉
@CBonkosky I can always change the scale.  Cases/ 100,000 ?

#Maryland #COVID #vaccinations.  Rates have declined, especially for 11 and under. Their cumulative percentage is low. Rates are going down in all races as well, but Hispanics still have the most. https://t.co/izxpQQsE9C

#Maryland #COVID by age. Cases declining in all.  The blip in 70s was indeed an anomaly and not real.  Deaths declining in all except 70s, which has leveled.  The 80s increase was temporary. Levels are about wherre they were in the fall. https://t.co/0PIyeEUJnc

#Maryland #COVID by race.  Cases declining in all.  Per capita, all are equal.  Deaths declining in all but Afr. Americans. which the rate has leveled off,  Per capita, they and Whites have the most, but White rates are trending down. https://t.co/95n0OeVQTR

#Maryland #COVID  #hospitalizations continue their decline for both beds and ICU. Rate of decline has slowed, especially ICU, but overall levels are low. Almost, but not quite, at the level of last summer. https://t.co/RYATsytokA

#Maryland #COVID by zip, case totals.These numbers show continued decline from previous weeks, but may be leveling off. Cumberland reclaims it spot as having the most. Next are Gaithersburg, Glen Burnie, Germantown, and Rockville. No Baltimore zip in the top 10; a notable change. https://t.co/izVqW7MZJL

#Maryland #COVID by zip, per capita.  Worst zips is Granstsville (3.88 new cases/1000) in Garrett.  That's lower than the high last week, 4.19 in Kitzmiller also in Garrett.  Declining in most places, but slowly in Garrett. https://t.co/inZHDNVxQQ

#Maryland #COVID deaths by county.  Per capita, the hardest hit is Talbot still at 0.05 deaths/1000.  Allegany and Washington has dropped to 0.03. The top 5 make up 15.3% of the deaths. The top 10, 25%.  Baltimore is out of the top 10. Totals are very low across the board. https://t.co/JPLUoq655O
@perreault_jim I always have scale these in my head...
